member.name: T:Triton.Controller.FrontController
member.summary: FrontController gets incoming requests from IIS and delegates processing to the appropriate Command.
member.remarks: IDEAS: In the DAOs, rather than always retrieving all fields, specify fields to be retrieved by each DAO in config file.
member.author: Scott Dyke

member.summary: Returns true if the instance is reusable, false otherwise.

member.summary: Gets or sets the virtual path to transmit with the current cookie.

member.name: T:Triton.Controller.Request.MvcHttpPostedFile
member.summary: MvcHttpPostedFile provides a way to access individual files that have been uploaded by a client. This is an Adapter class for HttpPostedFile.
member.remarks: The MvcPostedFileCollection class provides access to all the files uploaded from a client as a file collection. MvcHttpPostedFile provides properties and methods to get information on an individual file and to read and save the file. Files are uploaded in MIME multipart/form-data format and are buffered in server memory until explicitly saved to disk.
member.author: Scott Dyke

member.name: F:Triton.Controller.Request.MvcHttpPostedFile.baseFile
member.summary: Reference to the underlying HttpPostedFile object.

member.name: M:Triton.Controller.Request.MvcHttpPostedFile.#ctor(System.Web.HttpPostedFile)
member.summary: Constructs a new MvcHttpPostedFile adapter for the given HttpPostedFile.

member.name: M:Triton.Controller.Request.MvcHttpPostedFile.SaveAs(System.String)
member.summary: Saves the contents of an uploaded file.
member.param: The name of the saved file.

member.name: P:Triton.Controller.Request.MvcHttpPostedFile.Length
member.summary: Gets the size in bytes of an uploaded file.

member.name: P:Triton.Controller.Request.MvcHttpPostedFile.Name
member.summary: Gets the fully-qualified name of the file on the client's computer (for example "C:\MyFiles\Test.txt").

member.name: P:Triton.Controller.Request.MvcHttpPostedFile.Type
member.summary: Gets the MIME content type of a file sent by a client.

member.name: P:Triton.Controller.Request.MvcHttpPostedFile.InputStream
member.summary: Gets a Stream object which points to an uploaded file to prepare for reading the contents of the file.

member.summary: RequestFactory is the factory class for constructing requests that implement the MvcRequest interface.
member.author: Scott Dyke

member.summary: Constructs a MvcRequest of the appropriate type based on the information provided in the given HttpContext.

member.returns: A MvcRequest for the given context.

member.name: T:Triton.Controller.TimerModule
member.summary: TimerModule is an HttpModule that tracks the amount of time a request takes to process.
member.remarks: TimerModule attaches to the application BeginRequest and EndRequest events. On BeginRequest, it creates and starts a MvcTimer and attaches it to the request. On EndRequest, it retrieves the MvcTimer from the request and includes the elapsed time in the request response.
member.author: Scott Dyke

member.name: F:Triton.Controller.TimerModule.TIMER_NAME
member.summary: The name of the request Item to store the timer as.

member.name: M:Triton.Controller.TimerModule.Init(System.Web.HttpApplication)
member.summary: Implementation of IHttpModule.Init. Sets the event handlers for BeginRequest and EndRequest to start and stop the timer.
member.param: The HttpApplication processing the request.

member.name: M:Triton.Controller.TimerModule.Dispose
member.summary: Implementation of IHttpModule.Dispose. No unmanaged code that needs disposing.

member.name: M:Triton.Controller.TimerModule.StartTimer(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: The event handler for the BeginRequest event. Creates a new MvcTimer, starts it, and attaches it to the current request.
member.param: The application the event is for.
unused

member.name: M:Triton.Controller.TimerModule.StopTimer(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: The event handler for the EndRequest event. Gets the MvcTimer from the request, stops it, and write the elapsed time to the response.
member.param: The application the event is for.
unused

member.name: T:Triton.Controller.Utilities.WebUtilities
member.summary: Utility/helper class for web/http support.
member.author: Scott Dyke

member.name: M:Triton.Controller.Utilities.WebUtilities.GetIP(System.Web.HttpRequest)
member.summary: Gets the IP address of the client from which the given request originated.
member.remarks: This is basically to handle the problem introduced by Netscaler where it alters the REMOTE_ADDR header (Request's UserHostAddress property), and places the IP address in the HTTP_CLIENT_IP header.
member.param: The HttpRequest to get the origin IP of.
member.returns: The IP address of the client from which the given request originated

member.name: M:Triton.Controller.Utilities.WebUtilities.GetIP(Triton.Controller.Request.MvcRequest)
member.summary: Gets the IP address of the client from which the given request originated.
member.remarks: This is basically to handle the problem introduced by Netscaler where it alters the REMOTE_ADDR header (Request's UserHostAddress property), and places the IP address in the HTTP_CLIENT_IP header.
member.param: The MvcRequest to get the origin IP of.
member.returns: The IP address of the client from which the given request originated

member.name: M:Triton.Controller.Utilities.WebUtilities.GetUserName(System.Web.HttpRequest)
member.summary: Gets the logon user of the client request.
member.param: The HttpRequest to get the user name from.
member.returns: string The logon user of the client request.

member.name: M:Triton.Controller.Utilities.WebUtilities.HasValue(System.Web.HttpRequest,System.String)
member.summary: Determines if the fieldName item in request has a value or not. The item has a value if it is not NULL and a length > 0.
member.param: HttpRequest object containing the item to check
String containing the item name to check
member.returns: True if the item specified by fieldName is not NULL and has a length > 0, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Triton.Controller.Utilities.WebUtilities.HasValue(Triton.Controller.Request.MvcRequest,System.String)
member.summary: Determines if the fieldName item in request has a value or not. The item has a value if it is not NULL and a length > 0.
member.param: HttpRequest object containing the item to check
String containing the item name to check
member.returns: True if the item specified by fieldName is not NULL and has a length > 0, false otherwise.

member.name: T:Triton.Support.Mail.ServiceMailer
member.summary: Service Mailer does not contact the email server directly. Instead, it uses the service of another application to send out emails. It passes information to the service provider by issuing http requests and queues the requests if any error occurs.
member.author: Scott Dyke

member.name: F:Triton.Support.Mail.ServiceMailer.failedDir
member.summary: The directory to move queued messages to that have been retried the max # of times.

member.name: F:Triton.Support.Mail.ServiceMailer.queue
member.summary: The FileQueue that manages the queue of failed sends.

member.name: F:Triton.Support.Mail.ServiceMailer.queueCheckTime
member.summary: The interval, in minutes, to check and process the queue

member.name: F:Triton.Support.Mail.ServiceMailer.queueDir
member.summary: The directory to use to queue message that fail to go thru.

member.name: F:Triton.Support.Mail.ServiceMailer.ignoreParams
member.summary: Indicates request parameters which are to ignored from being added to the service. The initial defaults (to, emailtemplate) are set because otherwise they would be duplicated in the service send.

member.name: M:Triton.Support.Mail.ServiceMailer.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor.

member.name: M:Triton.Support.Mail.ServiceMailer.Send
member.summary: Sends out email

member.name: M:Triton.Support.Mail.ServiceMailer.ProcessQueueEntry(Triton.Support.Collections.FileQueueEntry)
member.summary: Processes an entry from the queue.
member.param: A file queue entry.
member.returns: A boolean value that specifies if the queue entry has been processed successfully.

member.name: M:Triton.Support.Mail.ServiceMailer.MaxedOutQueueEntry(Triton.Support.Collections.FileQueueEntry)
member.summary: Implements the MaxAttemptsProcessor delegate for the FileQueue. This is called by the FileQueue when a queued message is retried the max number of times. This method just moves the queue entry to another directory.
member.param: The queue entry that has been attempted the max # of times.

member.name: M:Triton.Support.Mail.ServiceMailer.SendRequest(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Attempts to send the request to the email service. It first tries sending to the primary server, and if that fails and a secondary server is specified in the config file, attempts the secondary server. If all attempts to send the request fail, the request is queued, and attempted again later.
member.param: The query string containing the parameters to send to the email service.
True if the request is from a queue entry, false if not.
member.returns: True if the request was successfully sent, false if the send failed.

member.name: M:Triton.Support.Mail.ServiceMailer.SendThreaded
member.summary: Creates a separate thread to call the method to perform the connection to the email service and send the email.

member.name: M:Triton.Support.Mail.ServiceMailer.SendToServiceThread
member.summary: Wrapper call to SendToService with void return type to allow for use as the delegate to be called from the thread in SendThreaded.

member.name: M:Triton.Support.Mail.ServiceMailer.SendToService
member.summary: Makes the connection to the email service and sends the request.

member.name: P:Triton.Support.Mail.ServiceMailer.EmailTemplate
member.summary: Specifies the email to be sent out (file name of the template file)

member.name: P:Triton.Support.Mail.ServiceMailer.Parameters
member.summary: Contains other information needed by the email.

member.name: P:Triton.Support.Mail.ServiceMailer.IgnoreParams
member.summary: Allows the addition of parameter names to ignore from being added to the service request.

member.summary: Public Default Constructor

member.name: T:Triton.Web.View.Controls.Pagination
member.summary: Paging control to use on search result thumbnails.

member.name: M:Triton.Web.View.Controls.Pagination.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor takes zero arguments.

member.name: M:Triton.Web.View.Controls.Pagination.IncludeParameter(System.String)
member.summary: Determines if the parameter is should be included in the rendered tag.

member.name: P:Triton.Web.View.Controls.Pagination.DisplayOptions
member.summary: Display Options are set on the control by comma separated list and will render in the order they are given. Options are: Numbers,Next,Prev,First,Last

member.name: P:Triton.Web.View.Controls.Pagination.Title
member.summary: The title tag to be rendered on all links

member.name: P:Triton.Web.View.Controls.Pagination.LinkClass
member.summary: Class name to be rendered on the anchor items for styling. Defaults to pageLink

member.name: P:Triton.Web.View.Controls.Pagination.NextRenderName
member.summary: Text to render for the "next" link. Defaults to "Next"

member.name: P:Triton.Web.View.Controls.Pagination.NextClass
member.summary: The name of the class to render on the "next" link.

member.name: P:Triton.Web.View.Controls.Pagination.PrevClass
member.summary: The name of the class to render on the "prev" link.

member.name: P:Triton.Web.View.Controls.Pagination.PrevRenderName
member.summary: Text to render for the "prev" link. Defaults to "Prev"

member.name: P:Triton.Web.View.Controls.Pagination.CurrentLinkClass
member.summary: Class name to be rendered on the currently selected link Defaults to currentPageLink

member.name: P:Triton.Web.View.Controls.Pagination.RequestItemName
member.summary: Name of the item in the request that contains the paged search results.

member.name: P:Triton.Web.View.Controls.Pagination.TransitionName
member.summary: Transition event for each page link.

member.name: P:Triton.Web.View.Controls.Pagination.PageParameterPrefix
member.summary: Prefix added to pagesize and page for sorting a particulate item type.

member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the request parameter for the page number.

member.name: P:Triton.Web.View.Controls.Pagination.PageSizeParameterName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the request parameter for the page size.

member.name: P:Triton.Web.View.Controls.Pagination.PageNumberDisplayStyle
member.summary: Takes a string: "Center", "Right", or "Left" and denotes which side of the page control the currently selected page is placed at.

member.name: P:Triton.Web.View.Controls.Pagination.Page
member.summary: The current WebPage.

member.name: P:Triton.Web.View.Controls.Pagination.AdditionalParameters
member.summary: Additional Parameters to append in search criteria

member.name: P:Triton.Web.View.Controls.Pagination.ResetUrlParameters
member.summary: Boolean value that, if set to true, will set the baseUrl to "/"

member.name: P:Triton.Web.View.Controls.Pagination.RenderPageSizeSelection
member.summary: Boolean value that determines if a page size control is rendered on the page. The values for the control are listed in the page's content copy under "PageSizeSelectorCopy". Choices are defaulted to increment from 0 to 5.

member.name: P:Triton.Web.View.Controls.Pagination.ParametersToExclude
member.summary: Comma seperated list of request Parameters to be removed from the url

member.name: M:Triton.Web.View.WebMasterPage.LoadMasterPage(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the master page according to the file name (without the extension) argument. Assumes the master page is in /PagesPath/Version/Site/Section/masterpages/ directory. This must be called in the Page_PreInit override method at the child masterpage level.

member.name: M:Triton.Web.View.WebMasterPage.LoadMasterPage(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the master page according to the file name (without the extension) argument. You set the section name, but site is automaticaly set. This must be called in the Page_PreInit override method at the child masterpage level.

member.name: M:Triton.Web.View.WebMasterPage.LoadMasterPage(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the master page according to the file name (without the extension) argument. Specify the section name and site. This must be called in the Page_PreInit override method at the child masterpage level.

member.name: P:Triton.Web.View.WebMasterPage.MasterPageSection
member.summary: Gets the masterpage section name, since the masterpage could be in a different section.

site of the xml file to look in

member.name: M:Triton.Web.View.WebPage.LoadMasterPage(System.String)

member.summary: Sets the master page according to the file name (without the extension) argument. You set the section name, but site is automaticaly set. This must be called in the OnPreInit override method at the page level.

member.summary: Sets the master page according to the file name (without the extension) argument. Specify the section name and site. This must be called in the OnPreInit override method at the page level.

member.summary: Reads the content XML and finds the copy for the supplied name. if the node is not found then search in the pages section.
member.param: Copy XML node name

member.summary: Reads the content XML and finds the copy for the supplied name. if the node is not found then search in the pages section.
member.param: Copy XML node name
Whether or not to return empty string or not found in xml text.

member.summary: Performs any text replacement of items enclosed in square brackets with request parameters of the same name.
member.param: string - Copy to parse
member.returns: parsed Copy

member.summary: Gets the site the page is in.

member.summary: Gets the section the page is in.

member.summary: Gets the language for the content for the page. Null if content is not in a language sub-directory.

member.summary: Get the name of the page.

member.summary: Gets the version for the site the page is for.

member.summary: Gets the State ID of the state the page represents (in the state machine).

member.name: P:Triton.Web.View.WebPage.SectionContentPath
